com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.data
Interface NativeString

All Superinterfaces:
CanBeNativeCapable, NativeCapable, NativeFieldContainer, NativeObjectFieldContainer, NativeSingleFieldContainer, NativeStringBased
All Known Subinterfaces:
NativeStringAnsi, NativeStringUnicode
public interface NativeString
extends NativeStringBased

The NativeString is the interface implemented by native capable classes working as wrappers of java.lang.String objects.

The framework defines an internal native class supporting ANSI and UNICODE encodings/sizes.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria

Method Detail

getString

java.lang.String getString()
Returns the internal String object synchronized with the native memory if instance is native.

If internal String object is null or native memory value is different to the String value hold by this instance, a new String object is created, saved and returned, otherwise the current object is returned.

Current implementation is:

return (String)getValue();

Returns:
the internal String object. Never is null.
See Also:
NativeSingleFieldContainer.getValue()

setString

void setString(java.lang.String value)
Sets the internal String object synchronizing the native memory with the new value if instance is native.

Current implementation is:

setValue(value);

Parameters:
value - the new value. Can not be null.
See Also:
NativeSingleFieldContainer.setValue(Object)
